Guide.page_title: Guide for Newly Arrived Refugees in Brazil
Guide.intro_paragraph: Upon arriving in Brazil as a refugee, it is essential to know your rights and the first steps to adapt and access basic services. This guide provides essential information for those starting a new life in Brazilian territory.
Guide.section_1_content: The first step should be to go to a Federal Police unit to register your asylum request. This request is free and provides an official protocol, which serves as a temporary valid document in the country.
Guide.section_2_content: With the asylum protocol, you can apply for a CPF (Individual Taxpayer Registry) and a Work Card (CTPS). This allows you to work legally, open a bank account, and use various public services.
Guide.section_3_content: The Unified Health System (SUS) offers free medical care to everyone. Just present a document (such as the asylum protocol) and proof of address at any health clinic.
Guide.section_4_content: Refugee children and adolescents have the right to free public education. It is possible to enroll them even without all documentation. Adults can also study through Youth and Adult Education (EJA) and revalidate diplomas from their country of origin.
Guide.section_5_content: Organizations such as Caritas, UNHCR, Missão Paz, and IMDH offer support with shelter, food, psychological care, Portuguese courses, and legal guidance. Look for a unit of these institutions in your city.
Guide.section_6_content: Learning Portuguese is an essential step to facilitate integration. Many NGOs and public schools offer free classes for immigrants and refugees.
Guide.section_7_content: Refugees have the right to religious freedom, protection against deportation, equal treatment, freedom of movement, and access to public services. Brazil is a signatory to the UN Refugee Convention and offers international protection.
Guide.disclaimer: This content is for informational purposes only. For personalized support, seek official bodies or specialized institutions that assist refugees.
